definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now

sentences.english: Confucius regarded the talent thought as the important part of his political system.
sentences.chinese: 人才思想是孔子政治思想體系的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: She was sharp-witted enough to dodge her attacker.
sentences.chinese: 她才思敏捷足以避開別人的攻擊。

sentences.english: His thought was quick and sparkled.
The author tries to make us master it comprehensively and profoundly by exploring the internal reasons.
sentences.chinese: 本文對這一重要人才思想產生的原因進行剖析。

sentences.english: Sims or creativeness is the wisdom of an important characteristic of agility.
sentences.chinese: 敏思或才思敏捷就是智慧的重要特徵。
他是一位才思敏捷的作家。

sentences.english: It come from growing smarter and wiser every day.
sentences.chinese: 幸福來自於每天增長的智慧和才思。

sentences.english: The talent thought was regarded as the important part of Confucian political system.
sentences.chinese: 人才思想是孔子政治思想體系的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: The tapping of talents' active power is a significant aspect of Lenin's theory of talents.
sentences.chinese: 人才動力開發是列寧人才思想的重要內容。

sentences.english: The talent thought of Confucian play an important role in the ancient talent-thought history.
sentences.chinese: 儒家人才思想在古代人才思想史上佔有重要地位。

sentences.english: This paper introduces the developing process of ancient Chinese thoughts of literature and art talents.
sentences.chinese: 介紹中國古代文藝人才思想的發展過程。

definition: literary talent/literary grace/rich and bright colors
the train of thought in writing
vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
to write a flawless essay in one go (idiom)/to be quick-witted and skilled at writing compositions
